snippet.title: CBA shares are on the way up again
snippet.content:
Shares in the Commonwealth rose in early trade, clawing back some of following allegations of breaches of money laundering laws.
A short time ago, the shares were up 1.1% to $81.63.
The other major banks were also up, including the NAB which had added 1.3% to $30.32.
Last week Australia's financial intelligence and regulatory agency, AUSTRAC, claiming the bank breached the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorism Financing (AML/CTF) Act over combined cash deposits of $624.7 million.
The bank, in a statement this morning, says to Intelligent Deposit Machines, the latest ATMs, in late 2012.
